page.title: 10WILDLIFE
page.content: Near Yearston Court and Kiln cottages there is a lot of{wildlife.}The rest of the countryside is the same. The same{creatures}seem to setle in all around here. Between Yearston Court and the road is a dried out lake and in this now-dry trench are lots of {oaks. Beeches}are also common. The trench is covered in dry leaves.{Grey {squirrels}and{rabbits}live there. It is quiet and dark. The{squirrels}often hop about in the leaves.{Tawny owl's nests are plentiful in the trees. {Foxes}live amongst the tree roots and the young{cubs}play there. It is a quiet, pleasant place. But recently, in the brook behind the court, that goes into{Sapey brook, mink}have been found. They are disturbing the wildlife. They are a pest and people are trying to get rid of them. {by Patrick Turner (age 11)
